conclusion: Determine the electric field at point A due to charges at cube vertices.
Charges +2q and -q are at adjacent cube corners; distance is edge length L.
Midpoint O is equidistant from both charges; distance is L/sqrt(2).
Electric field E1 at O due to +2q is k(4q/L^2).
Electric field E2 at O due to -q is k(-2q/L^2).
Resultant electric field magnitude at O is E = k(2sqrt(5)q/L^2).
Point A is at the opposite vertex of the cube; distance to charges is Lsqrt(3).
Electric field at A due to +2q is k(2q/3L^2).
Electric field at A due to -q is k(-q/3L^2).
Resultant electric field at A is EA = k(sqrt(5)q/3L^2).
Magnitude of electric field at point A is k(sqrt(5)q/3L^2).
